intro: Meximalva retusa, commonly known as the silky mallow, is a herbaceous plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features soft, fuzzy leaves and produces showy, pale pink to white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Meximalva retusa is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
